pages.text: Shiba Inus have two genes that affect how they look. These are the B Locus and the C Locus. The B Locus determines whether a dog has red or black fur, while the D Locus is a dilution gene that creates cream coloring.

The B Locus has two potential alleles, the dominant 'B' and the recessive 'b'. The 'B' allele creates red fur, while the 'b' allele creates black fur. Dogs with one copy of 'b' will carry the black trait and may pass it on to pups, providing the potential for black pups depending on the other parent. Dogs with two copies of 'b' will always create either black carriers or black puppies.
pages.title: B Locus

pages.text: The D Locus has two potential alleles, the dominant 'D' and the recessive 'd'. The 'D' allele does not affect the coat's color, while the 'd' allele is a dilute that creates pale, or cream, fur. Dogs with one copy of 'd' will carry the dilution trait and may pass it on to pups, providing the potential for diluted pups depending on the other parent. Dogs with two copies of 'd' will always create either dilute carriers or cream puppies.
pages.title: D Locus
